headline: Very poor line management, checking in for salary
pros: Salary comes as precise as a swiss watch.

The new hires are being lied on how they will work to change the company and mindset then you find no support in your management as you hit the thick walls of the corporate mindset.

You can forget about a raise in pay or career advancement, that's just a nice story when you are hired. Top performer employees leave as fast as they come.

No strategy nor direction. Everybody just ticks checkboxes to justify their paycheck.

The waiting times are over 30 min. 
Clients get their accounts closed with no notice - they allegedly get something through post - but that's the way you contact clients in 1960 - posting a letter that never arrives...
You tell clients they will never have their accounts closed if they have money on them -> bs - the bank does whatever they want because certain people don't know how to do their job.

headline: A good & stable place to work but corporate environment ultimately not for me
pros: RBA as a corporation is a place with stable employment opportunities, decent salaries, and in my experience very good colleagues. Of course, not everything is peachy, but overall my experience there was pretty good (if not great). Not to take away from RBA as an employer, that might just be coming down to my personality which isn't suited to corporate work.
cons: Sometimes I felt there was a level of toxicity in the air, not just between teams but also within the team as well which was well over what I'm comfortable with. Changes were usually relatively slow in coming (as it is in any big system). Sometimes there also seemed to be a problem with different parts of the organization not always knowing what the other parts are doing.

headline: Nice place for working

I could say honesty everything to my boss. If I have some problem, my boss and rest of team were prepared to help me.  The work I learned quickly.
cons: Clime in open space. Vacation - we could choose ourselves, because we had to respect busy periods and time, when our colleagues are on vacation. We  had to take all vacation to the end of year. I wanted more training.

headline: Very bad culture, subjective evaluation of your professional skills, sick environment.
pros:
There are lots of areas to improve:
- very old infrastructure which is mostly an opportunity since there is a long way to walk
- progressive ideas and projects
cons:
Very bad interpersonal relations, hypocrisy, lack of people who would like to take responsibility, since sooner or later they got cornered. So there are still enthusiasts full of energy who could do nothing. Political power is in wrong hands which are afraid even from simple change, no matter what they share proudly. Mobbing and rumors are something usual.
The game there is to support each idea of your manager, agree with mostly stupid decisions which will guarantee you "stable career"
The bank is still loosing ground so thing would become even worse.

cons: relatevely slow career growth, wages usually below the market; this environment is nice but sometimes not ready-to-change

headline: It was a very exciting opportunity to understand how a bank works in the retail segment and you can upgrade yourself.
pros: There are good payments and also a good job opportunity for beginner bankers to meet new problems and try to solve them in the most efficent way and meet with the brand of Raiffeisen bank Hungary.
cons: I think it was a little bit booring and sometimes I felt I was just a small part of the huge capitalist money pumping machine. There are no good opportunities to go to a higher level if sou dont have friends in the boss team.

headline: Great experience
pros:
- work-life balance OK
- good benefits package
- incurages an active lifestyle
- paid overtime
cons:
- lack of involvment from top management
- few opportunities for promotion

headline: Great company to work, in terms of hours and compensation
pros: western culture, competitive pay and good work / life balance
cons: Career growth and promotions

headline: very positive
pros:
strong and comfortable corporate culture
good caree prospects
cons: tough pressure on sales people

headline: Competitive salary. Good office culture.
pros: Competitive salary. Good payments leaves and nlots of partys and after hours drinks etj.
cons: No career advancement. Familiarism in all managerial levels. Very long shifts.

headline: Good but i could have been better
pros: Competitive salaries, latest technology, good office culture.
cons: Familiarisem in all managerial levels, same managers for years, can't advance in position, u'll stay at the same place forever :(

headline: Well trained staff
pros: great values, acceptable pay and resourceful environment;
cons: nothing comes in mind

headline: A true business school
pros: Friendly people, coherent workflows, communicative managers, perfect place to learn modern banking.  Continuos development of processes and IT sistems. Nice environment, modern working conditions.
cons: Employees are not valued as they should be. If one decides to go, nobody does nothing to keep him. No matter of his value, experience, performance, etc.

headline: Good job but could always be better
pros: Wonderful young team of professionals, friendly atmosphere, office situated in a good location, possibilities for growth within the company, education within the company provided, company's values
cons: very strong management style that is narrowing the individual as personality, not many options to change that if you want to keep within the company

headline: Retail Manager
pros: Good place to learn banking, MbO's are SMART and everyone knows their responsibilities.
cons:
At the management level, all are family - literally. You can't promote because of all the relatives who are on the list.
No leadership whatsoever at all management levels.
The company is product-centric, customers should always be willing to pay/buy more because the business liness believes that sales is about people skills and not adding value trough products and services.

headline: A good experience for all beginners
pros: A good banking school for any beginner, probably the best in Romania.
cons:
The very frequent organizational changes create uncertainty. LEAN in Raiffeisen is nothing else than an umbrella under which "legal" changes are made (dismissal of staff), creating chaos and fear in personnel who will never perform at the expected level!
Promotions are very hard to get (there is no career path plan defined).
Wages are very low compared to the market in Romania.

headline: Raiffaiswnbank, Russia
pros:
- Good "white" salary
- paid vacation (28 days)
- paid sickness
- special proposes for banks products (credits, deposits, cards, etc)
- medical insurance
- corporate pension plan
-special proposes from partners (auto, insurance, realty, etc)
cons:
- we are in process of reallocation to low-cost location
- too narrow specialization
- there is no career perspective
- too much bureaucracy

headline: Good place to learn and grow
pros: Lots of opportunities to learn and grow, to get involved in different kind of activities, at work and outside it. Some very good senior managers.
cons: Big organization, objectives between departments not always aligned, lots of internal politics

headline: Downsizing trend
pros:
Good working conditions
Company Culture
Work Life balance
cons:
Lower salaries than in other banks in Croatia
Double standards for advancing

headline: Good job
pros: One of the biggest bank in Ukraint, Careers opportunity
cons: You should know english well, to work here

headline: Pleasant internship experience
pros: Flexible work, relatively good wages for non interns, adapting environment. I personally worked with very good and qualified people, but this is not always the case.
cons: The main office is far away from downtown, interns aren't paid much, and the company is a corporation, so it has many problems with efficiency and rationality (many things have to be by the book).

headline: Assistant to Relationship Manager at Corporate Clients Department
author_position: Assistant to Relationship Manager At Corporate Clients Department
pros: RBA is a good company, where I've started my first real full time job after graduation.  In general good social package and average market salary withing banking field in Kiev.
cons: Competition among my former employees was unhealthy. Work/life balance was not really fantastic due to our working hours from 8.30 am till 7.30 pm. I wish our overtime hours where paid off.

headline: Not for the vocal and ambitious
pros:
Good worklife balance. 
Great IT support.
cons:
Incompetent HR. Pro management, cuts employee benefits.
Low increments, long service staffs are usually paid below market rate.

headline: Great opportunity for every one
pros: great company to start a career, high qualified personal,equal chances for every one to grow, all depends on your personal performance, very team-driven
cons: non competative salaries and compansations

headline: Working at Raiffeisen
pros: Great benefits, lots of international colleagues, great cantine
cons: rigid hierarchy, great coffee there

headline: Raiffeisenbank (Bulgaria) EAD
pros: Good place and good people. There are many possibility to work on interesting projects and to improve professional competencies. The main advantage is the pleasure to work with experienced colleagues.
cons: I think middle management could improve its managerial capabilities. Some of them are good enough but there are others which should work on that.

headline: Stable company with adequate management and conservative strategy
pros:
Good work/life balance
Friendly environment and corporate culture
cons:
Average salary, in some cases lower the average market level
Limited career development

headline: Senior analyst
pros: Atmosphere in office. Very stable bank
cons: All business processes was very slowly.

headline: Best professionals in Banking, Ukraine
pros: Quick professional growth due to 1) international owners, 2) much work, 3) interesting work contents, 4) long bank history = much experience accumulated already; 5) good professional surrounding; 6) great trainings.
cons: 1) Much work, 2) medium salary; 3) long time to pass from idea to implementation because of bulky administrative structure.

headline: Account Officer
pros: very good working environment with very good conditions for basic operations
cons: to high target, very chalenging

headline: positive
pros: strong franchise, good experts in risk, products
cons: office politics based decisions; uneven level of competences among staff

headline: Good salaries
pros: Great Office place, good salary, good coworkers, the management was skilled.
cons: Extended hours. Other than that, there is not so much more to talk about.

headline: Raiffeisen Bank
pros: Reputation, Expertise, Success, Growth plans, Stability
cons: The organization is too big hence growth within from an entry level to a medium level position...in some time.

headline: i really like my responsibilities there
pros: good corporate culture, career growth, team building programs
cons: long communication between departments, strong corporate policy

headline: Asstistant Manager
pros: Great work environment, learning opportunities
cons: less business, needs to expand business strategies

headline: Great company
pros: Friendly co-workers and good benefits
cons: almost no chance to get  a promotion

headline: Good bank to work for
pros: Western approach, democratic environment, good practice
cons: lower salary, sometimes boring, not too much challenges

headline: Intern
pros: There was a good atmosphere, people were nice and professional
cons: I can't think of any

headline: Raiffeisenbank Russia
pros: Good atmoshere and corporate culture, excellent corporate university, excellent opprotunity of gaining experience.
cons: Very conservative compensation policy, salary level in regions of Russia is only on the industry average, lack of career growth opportunities.

headline: RBA Zagreb
pros: It is one of the 4 biggest banks in Croatia. Once you get a full-time contract your job is quite safe.
cons: Salaries are frozen for a long time. Bosses are pretty stressed which influences the overall atmosphere. Overtime is not paid.

headline: I'm senior legal officer, i have two years of experience in that Bank
pros: well organized bank, positive working environment, good business offices, good interpersonal relations, solid training opportunities, people contact, variety, challenging and stimulating work
cons: Long hours, stress, pressure to learn things very quickly & performing to a high standard, having to take banking exams - involving revising after a day's work, pressure to meet branch targets

headline: Kherson Central Back Office of RBA is a good place for local students to get first experience
pros:
Easy to get a job for students, good chance to get first experience
Rather good conditions in the office: water, kitchen, AC
cons:
Extremely low salaries
Few opportunities for career and salary growth
People are not very intelligent

headline: Career in Retail Department, Raiffeisenbank Russia
pros: Great  management team and good corporate culture. Very interesting place to develop yourself and get quick promotion if you are hardworking, enjoy challenging tasks and communication both with customers and peers. Great training center and coaching system.
cons: Sales people are in demand. Those who doesn't enjoy sales plan will not be happy in retail department. The bank has very high sales plans but sometimes unable to provide front office with qualified workforce to reach these aims.

headline: Head of Sales and Branch Network Development Department
author_position: Head of Sales and Branch Network Development Department
pros:
It is a big machine, so you can try to be multi-functions banker
Of course, you will not be welcomed with such attitude, but helping people to solve their problems and do their job is a-door-opener
cons: If you think you will be adequetely assessed - give up those dreams. You could be twice, three times cleverer than your peer, but do have your opinion (whan asked) which is different from your boss's - and you will neveк be promoted. The shareholders' values for a board of the bank are nothing. So, see your work in the bank as only an opportunity to gather more knowledge.

headline: a place to learn but not to grow
pros: great colleagues, good social benefits
cons: old systems, do not value labour

headline: system administrator
pros: Very good place for work
cons: too many level of bureaucracy

headline: Great place to work
pros: Nice colleagues, very helpful, good personnel policy
cons: I don't have any cons

headline: IT contracts and bids, Telecom, IT Projects, Portfolio and Biz Analist
pros: A good background and experience in Romanian banking market
cons: Too many restructuring in last 5 years

headline: Big bank that offers a great start to your career
pros: Expensive software an trainings that are paid by the bank.
cons: Too much bureaucracy and some staff is older than it should be.

headline: Slow banking
pros: young motivated team - at least the ones I'm working with, corporate social responsibility, nice president, decent compensation, decent premisses in head office
cons: it is very sad that the guys have no idea whatsoever about career management, career planing and related topics. or it's always a big secret.

headline: demanding but at the end of the day rewording
pros:
- very good work environment
- great team and very good colleagues, professionals that knew their business
- open doors policy from the management side
cons:
- not very good chances to advance carrier wise
- if you are not part of a “political group” (“bisericuta”) you will not be able to make yourself heard

headline: good company if you aren't chasing fast career advancement
pros: Good social policy, big bonuses
cons: Slow career advancement if any

headline: Good company for a start of the career.
pros: Very experienced professionals and good working environment.
cons: Very bad management on all leading levels and too big intragroup bureaucracy.

headline: Good experience growing up in a professional environment
pros: Young working environment, challenging and professionally rewarding
cons: Compensation and benefits not always matching the work done

headline: Trainee Programm
pros: Relaxed Environment, with opportunities to learn from many departments!
cons: Confusing structures! Sometimes not much to do

headline: every day is a challenge
pros: international bank experience and  knowlwdges
cons: low level salary for new entry employee

headline: Ukraine RBA, 2011-2012 - not a best time to work here.
pros: Raiffeisen Bank Aval has a big team, developing company and you can develop here personally. Social welfare under the laws of Ukraine. Good customer care.
cons: Reduction of workplaces for a long time. Low salaries of ordinary employees and uninteresting bonuses. It is often necessary to sell the non-competitive services.

headline: A former good employer
pros: Good culture and value, good market image,
cons: HR strategy inadequate, no carrier plan for employee,unbalanced wage policy

headline: in cultural aspect it was a good experienceto work there
pros: Good for CV to have a working experience in one of the largest european bank groups, plus one of market Leaders in Bulgaria
cons: The competence of all management is very low, very authoritarian way of managing the employees, no opportunities for career development.

headline: Good place to work if you like  hour office job!
pros:
Good salary 
Good benefits
Excellent HR Department 
If you are lucky you can work with some extraordinary people and make a lifetime friendships
Great locations and very nice offices
Some directors are righteous and very honest and know how to treat employees
cons:
Sometimes you don't have time to eat during a work hours 
Some managers are totally incompetent for what they do 
Dress code, but it is pretty much the same in all banks 
Some managers don't provide any assistance to their employees but require very high and difficult goals to be met

headline: Could be much better
pros:
good work-life balance
great location
laid back atmosphere
friendly co-employees
cons:
salary and bonuses too low
not enough career development
lots of turnover
prefer to hire from outside instead of rewarding those who have been there the longest

headline: Waste of time
pros: There are no good things I could say
cons: Bad reputation, newspers and FBI described the board to take bribes (simple internet search and wikipedia), several Country managing directors lived and encouraged bribes from investors/clients.  Very stingy and deceptive - never pay out bonuses as promised and came up with any reason to hold bonuses back.  Hired MDs of low caliber to save on salaries.  Functioned as a research shop for Lazard.
